Time Of Resitence (2004) and From Glauber To Jirges 
<
From the testimony of over 30 people directly involved in resistance to dictatorship, and striking images from files, Time of Resistance reveals the history of this long and nebulous period in brazilian history, which spanned over 20 years, bringing knowledge and awareness to young people particular.
Packaged by the music of Chico Buarque, Francis Hime and Geraldo Vandre, the film reveals the entire process for the coup rally since President Joao Goulat until the day of Amnesty. Discusses the consequences of the dictatorship in the state of SÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â£o Paulo, Ribeirao Preto, and as in the interior of Brazil.
This is a true account of the period of military dictatorship in the country, seen and told by those who lived in the skin the consequences of repression and authoritarianism, as Jose Dirceu, Aloysio Nunes, Franklin Martins, Leopoldo Pauline Crispin Denize, among others militants of the time.
